speaker: WAITER
line: Excuse me. Do you want that warmed up?

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: No. But I’ll buy another one if you’ll leave me alone.

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: We’ll see about that.

speaker: BUYER
line: Eight ball.

speaker: JACKSON
line: Yeah?

speaker: VOICE
line: Hello, Jackson.

speaker: JACKSON
line: How’d you get this number?

speaker: VOICE
line: What do you care? You’re partner, Kenny Slater, he took your money, didn’t he? I want to help you, Jackson.

speaker: JACKSON
line: Help me what?

speaker: VOICE
line: Slater’s in the Metro Diner. 14th and Arlington.

speaker: JACKSON
line: He’s in Florida by now, man... Jamaica, Cuba...

speaker: VOICE
line: No. He’s here. In the Metro Diner. 14th and Arlington.

speaker: JACKSON
line: 14th and Arlington. It’s Kenny. The fool’s come back.

speaker: VOICE
line: The men who took your product Friday night are in the Metro Diner.

speaker: CRACK DEALER
line: 14th and Arlington.

speaker: VOICE
line: Spanish Jack is in the Metro Diner – 14th and Arlington. I understand you wish to speak with him.

speaker: GWDLSJ
line: 14th and Arlington.

speaker: BOYCE
line: Boyce.

speaker: VOICE
line: Pico Salazar is in the Metro Diner.

speaker: BOYCE
line: Salazar? Who is this?

speaker: VOICE
line: 14th and Arlington.

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: Oh... sharper than a serpent’s tooth to have a thankless child.

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: Now you know what’s coming, and there’s nothing you can do.

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: You won’t feel a thing.

speaker: BOYCE
line: US Marshalls! On the floor!

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: No!

speaker: BOYCE
line: Get down, now!

speaker: LAPTOP MAN
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: Charles Figgis, ten year veteran of the US Marshall’s Service. Multiple gunshot wounds, high speed Teflon rounds. His partner, Gerald Boyce was DOA at Mercy General. Tried to catch a nine millimeter slug in his teeth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like they crashed the wrong party.

speaker: MULDER
line: Figgis and Boyce had radioed in that they were coming here to apprehend Pico Salazar.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Pico Salazar?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Colombian Cartel’s banking liaison. Salazar escaped from federal custody three months ago. Boyce and Figgis were on the offender transport squad that lost him. They took his escape personally. A phone tip told them that Salazar was going to be here tonight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A foreign national with his kind of connections? What would he be doing here, let alone in the country?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think he is... or was. But there were a lot of very photogenic gentlemen that were.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, these are street level coke dealers... Minor wholesalers at most.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, not the type you’d expect to associate with a cartel boss.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What would they be doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe it was for the pie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’S 2:45 in the morning. You mind telling me what it is we’re supposed to be looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: Donald Gelman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Donald Gelman --- Silicon Valley software pioneer. He’s been missing since 1979.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you recognize him?

speaker: MULDER
line: He invented the internet. Well, he didn’t quite invent it, but he’s a Silicon Valley folk hero. He was writing internet software even before there was an internet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why have I never heard of him?

speaker: MULDER
line: On the eve of the deal that was going to set him up as another Bill Gates he went hiking in the Sierras and said he’d think about it. Never came back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I still don’t see the connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that’s the point.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, why was Gelman in there?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think somebody obviously wanted him dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think this was a hit on him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Eight unconnected dealers all at the same place at the same time, all tipped off by phone looking for somebody, last call goes to the Marshalls, they arrive, place explodes, Gelman dies in the crossfire. It’s genius.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, did you take a look at him? Why kill a man who is dying. His body is a bag of bones.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, when you’re talking about Donald Gelman you want to kill the brain, not the body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that’s evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gee, I hope so.

speaker: PLATTERS
line: HEAVENLY SHADES OF NIGHT ARE FALLING IT’S TWILIGHT TIME OUT OF THE MIST YOUR VOICE IS CALLING ‘TIS TWILIGHT TIME WHEN PURPLE COLORED CURTAINS MARK THE END OF DAY...

speaker: BYERS
line: Jobs and Wozniak at Apple, Gates and Allen writing Basic, the homebrew computer club’s first meetings. Gelman was there.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Now they’re power brokers and billionaires. Back then they were just... inspired nerds.

speaker: MULDER
line: All except Gelman.

speaker: BYERS
line: Gelman was a part of the group, but not one of them. At 28 he was ..the old man. Some say the brightest of all.

speaker: LANGLY
line: He wrote some of the earliest viruses.

speaker: MULDER
line: And found himself under investigation by the NSA.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that why he disappeared?

speaker: BYERS
line: Gelman? Gelman was a visionary, not a capitalist. A subversive.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: This is a one-off. I’ve never seen anything like it. Gelman built this?

speaker: MULDER
line: That may be what got him killed.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Heavy casualty.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: A brother goes down.

speaker: MULDER
line: I found this in his CD ROM drive.

speaker: BYERS
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Twilight Time."

speaker: LANGLY
line: We’re up against 64 bit encryption... as password that’s a random sequence of twelve symbols. Gelman’s got this baby sealed tight.

speaker: BYERS
line: This CD has some kind of enhanced background data. Lots of code. Maybe a programming design.

speaker: MULDER
line: What for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Anyone ùh, think to check his e-mail.

speaker: BYERS
line: David missing, fear the worst, the hunted has become the hunter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Invisigoth?"

speaker: BYERS
line: Could be an address.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Seven digits. An alpha numeric string of four.

speaker: MULDER
line: Standard ID. Shipping container.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There must be a thousand containers here..... and in no particular order.

speaker: MULDER
line: Frohike says this place is really proud of its accurate tracking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If not in their computer security.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Should be straight ahead. Three rows and to the right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds like somebody’s home.

speaker: MULDER
line: FBI. Come....

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m all right! Go get her!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop! FBI!

speaker: SCULLY
line: FBI! Stop, or I’ll shoot!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Home sweet home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you "Invisigoth?"

speaker: ESTHER
line: How did you find me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Donald Gelman’s mailbox. You left a return address.

speaker: ESTHER
line: You know where Donald is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don’t you let us ask the questions.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Why don’t you bite me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like what you’re doing here and what all this stuff is.

speaker: ESTHER
line: And why would I tell you even if you could understand?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just committed felony assault on a federal agent, followed by resisting arrest.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Arrest for what? Unless you got a warrant, you two just busted in here and seriously violated a buttload of my constitutional rights.

speaker: MULDER
line: We had just cause to come in.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Yeah? Now we’ve got just cause to get out.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that?

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s a surveillance module. It monitors computing processes.

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s locking up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is?

speaker: ESTHER
line: A DOD satellite .. Warbird grade orbital weapons platform. We’ve got to get out of here!

speaker: SCULLY
line: A weapons platform?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully....

speaker: ESTHER
line: You don’t understand! That thing has optical systems that can read headlines on a newspaper. .

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully....

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s targeting us!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You want us to believe that the Department of Defense wants to kill you?

speaker: ESTHER
line: No, it’s controlling their satellite!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re out of your mind.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, we’ve got to get out of here right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this is absurd!

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s locked. Give me the keys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: ESTHER
line: We’re all gonna die!

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me the keys!

speaker: MULDER
line: Get in the car, Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No more screwing around. We need a name. Your real name.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Invisigoth. You want my address? It’s T - O - A - S - T.

speaker: MULDER
line: When you said "it" was targeting us back there, you meant an artificial intelligence. Donald Gelman was trying to create a sentient AI. A program with its own consciousness. He succeeded, didn’t he?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Donald wrote an interlocked sequence of viruses 15 years ago. It got loose on the net.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait, what do you mean, "got loose?"

speaker: ESTHER
line: He let it loose... so it could evolve in its natural environment. Urschleim in silicon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Urschleim in silicon?"

speaker: ESTHER
line: The primordial slime? The ooze out of which all life evolved. Except this time it’s artificial slime - artificial life. One man alone achieving the equivalent of Copernicus, Magellan, and Darwin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what was your role in all this? Were you the bass player?

speaker: MULDER
line: nan

speaker: ESTHER
line: Automata Theory, MIT 95. Post doc the Santa Fe Institute. Head hunted to Kobayashi my junior year. Then Donald showed up in Tokyo and made me a better offer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A better offer to do what?

speaker: ESTHER
line: You wouldn’t understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jeez...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You believe this load of crap?

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw what happened back there, Scully. You saw that container blow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She could have rigged an explosive charge. There are no weapons platforms, there is no such Department of Defense satellite.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Star Wars? Brilliant Pebbles?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They were never built! We don’t even have that kind of technology. I mean, even if an artificial intelligence was targeting us, with an armed satellite, why isn’t it doing it right now?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Because it doesn’t know where we are. If I so much as made a phone call right now, it would nuke us right where we’re standing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Recognizes my voice, monitors all communication. I haven’t used a phone in over a month.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then how did it know to target the container?

speaker: ESTHER
line: All I can think is that some idiot got on Donald’s computer and tried to contact me over the net. Only Donald knew where I was. And David.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who’s David?

speaker: ESTHER
line: David Markham. He was hardware. Donald and I were software. We’d been caring for the AI, weaning it. Then Donald warned us that the system started to display more than consciousness. It started to display intention. But before we could stop it, it was gone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: ESTHER
line: I don’t know. One day David was on the system and it wouldn’t come, it wouldn’t come when we called it. We knew it was out there somewhere on the Global Net, but it wouldn’t answer, and Donald was just getting sicker.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you can’t find it?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Well, it’s not a program any more. It’s wildlife loose on the net. And either we kill it....Where’s Donald?

speaker: MULDER
line: Donald Gelman is dead. He was killed in a café. What looks like a hit.

speaker: ESTHER
line: That’s the AI protecting itself. It’ll find David and.... me. It’s only a matter of time. Donald was writing a concatenation of viruses designed to find and immobilize the rogue system. The file name was "Kill Switch." Without it, nobody can catch it.

speaker: MULDER
line: We have Donald’s computer.

speaker: ESTHER
line: No, he’d never leave it on the hard drive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we have this. "Twilight Time."

speaker: ESTHER
line: That’s it. That’s the Kill Switch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: nan

speaker: BYERS
line: Ai -yi -yi

speaker: FROHIKE
line: It can’t be... it is.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Esther Nairn. You programmed the autonomous bots in Ninjitsu Princess, the most gnarliest piece of entertainment software ever.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Are these the brain donors that nearly got us incinerated?

speaker: MULDER
line: Don’t let their looks fool you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your name is Esther Nairn?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She is so hot.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Are you going to take off the cuffs, or do I have to do this with my tongue?

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t want to take a vote.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Give me the Kill Switch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aren’t you worried it’s going to track you, Esther? Hunt you down with another particle beam?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Not unless someone else makes another boneheaded internet connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this?

speaker: ESTHER
line: That’s the sharp end of the stick. Donald probably tried to feed this sector in over the net, but it took too long, so the system was able to take counter-measures.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why didn’t it just zap him, too?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Its creator? No, it needed to impress Donald. Particle beam would’ve been overkill.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unlike a dozen crack dealers.

speaker: ESTHER
line: No, you see that’s its sense of humor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, all right. But if you load the Kill Switch, what’s to stop it from playing another funny joke on us?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Well, obviously we can’t inject Kill Switch over the Net. feed it the poisoned apple.

speaker: MULDER
line: Physically?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Right into its eager little CD drive. It knew it couldn’t hide over the Net forever, not until it learned to completely disguise itself. It requires a physical nexus of hardware so somewhere its built itself a little safehouse. David went looking for it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he find it?

speaker: ESTHER
line: There’s no way to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don’t you just call him. Oh, right – death from above.

speaker: LANGLY
line: It would need bandwidth.

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s a pig for bandwith.

speaker: BYERS
line: It would need a T3, at least.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: A hard line – 45 megs a second.

speaker: BYERS
line: Major research labs and internet service providers use them.

speaker: LANGLY
line: But the government keeps those records secret for fear of sabotage.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Gee, you guys know anyone that works for the government?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Shh. Buenos dias, muchacha.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I’ve found something down in Fairfax County. A derelict chicken farm with a T3 connection, paid for by Aleph Industries, Palo Alto, of which there’s no other record anywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dandy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you? Sounds like you’re driving.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You are correct, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have Esther with you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In a manner of speaking.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Left up here. Give me that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you going?

speaker: ESTHER
line: To find David.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where? MULDER Scully? Scully?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Go ahead! Put me out of my misery! Take it!

speaker: MULDER
line: FBI! I’m a federal agent.!

speaker: NAME
line: Fox Mulder

speaker: HEIGHT
line: 6 ft

speaker: WEIGHT
line: 170 lbs.

speaker: HAIR
line: Brown

speaker: EYES
line: Green

speaker: DATE OF BIRTH
line: 13 October, 1961

speaker: MARITAL STATUS
line: Unmarried FBI Career History 1983-1986 Oxford University 1986 Quantico Academy 1988 Assigned to the Violent Crimes Unit 1990-PRESENT Assigned to the X-Files Education-Oxford University AB in Psychology Graduating summa cum laude in 1982 Quantico FBI training Academy 1984 Graduating with honors.)

speaker: ESTHER
line: I lied to you. I wasn’t working with Donald. I mean, I was, and then he found out about us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About you and who.

speaker: ESTHER
line: David. About our plans.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What plans did he find out?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Uploading. Transfer of memory, of consciousness to the distributed system maintained by the AI. Imagine being mingled so completely with another, you no longer need your physical self – you’re one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you were going to –

speaker: ESTHER
line: Enter the AI. Give up our inefficient bodies so that our consciousness could live together forever.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But Donald Gelman forbade it.

speaker: ESTHER
line: He was afraid of his creation. He was afraid of what would happen if other people followed us. I loved him so much.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe he wasn’t here when this happened. Maybe he’s somewhere else.

speaker: MULDER
line: David Markham.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s going on?

speaker: EMT
line: Severe tissue injuries to upper extremities. We’ve got ourselves a real crispy critter, here.

speaker: EMT 2
line: Alert the burn unit. Tell them to scramble the surgical team.

speaker: EMT
line: Unit 23 – request Burn Unit.

speaker: EMT 2
line: He’s coming up on us.

speaker: EMT
line: Surgical team, stat.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s that smell? Oh, jeez...

speaker: EMT
line: Easy now.

speaker: EMT 2
line: Just relax.

speaker: EMT
line: 120 BP 130 over 80

speaker: EMT 2
line: Frank charring at contact site, along path of current, and at exit point. Looks like the charge grounded through both arms. We’ve got a lot of work to do, here, people, if we’re going to save him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it bad?

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: You’re in good hands.

speaker: MULDER
line: My arms hurt.

speaker: EMT
line: That’s a good sign

speaker: MULDER
line: No, wait.... Call my doctor. You have to call... my doctor. Call Dr. Scully. Please call Dr. Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Call her. No, no. No... what are you doing?

speaker: VERY OLD SURGEON
line: Prep the patient.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. No.

speaker: MULDER
line: No-no-no-no! Ahhhhh!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can’t get through to Mulder.

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s the AI. Its had time to analyze my voice. It knows I was using your phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It can interfere with my phone?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Give it enough information, it’ll sue you for palimony.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a minute. Mulder said that he found the system. In an abandoned chicken farm in Fairfax county.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Well, maybe we can cut off the T3 and kill its communication capabilities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can do that?

speaker: ESTHER
line: There’s only one way to find out.

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel sick.

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: That’s the anesthetic, Agent Mulder. You were injured and they had to operate.

speaker: MULDER
line: I remember... wires, and uh...

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: Yes, you were doing something dangerous. Something very, very foolish. The good news is they were able to save the right one.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, my God. What did you do with my arm? What did they do with my arm?

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: Shh.... or they’ll come back.

speaker: MULDER
line: They’ll come back for what?

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: They’re evil, Fox. They want something from you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do they want?!

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: I don‘t know. But if you don’t tell them, I’m afraid they’ll take your other arm.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is crazy! You have to help me. You have to get me out of here... please! Help me. Help me. Please, help me.

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: Shh... or they’ll hear you. Shhh....

speaker: ESTHER
line: Something’s wrong. I didn’t do anything. I didn’t even get on the Net! I think it found us. It’s zeroing in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Esther... Get away from the tanker truck!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir? You need to get out of the truck. Move it! It’s going to explode. Dump it, Esther! Get rid of it!

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s got the Kill Switch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Esther! Dump it! Esther! Get rid of it! Get rid of it , Esther!

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I had this terrible dream. And then I had a good dream.

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: Those weren’t dreams, Fox. I believe that’s enough for now. You poor thing. But I warned you. Nurse Nancy warned you. You have to tell them, Fox. You have to.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell them what?

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: About the Kill Switch.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody asked me anything.

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: You’ve just forgotten, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: I was there. The doctor asked and he was very cross when you refused to answer. But he’ll be here in just a few minutes, and you can tell him then.

speaker: NURSE NANCY
line: Otherwise, whoops! There go your legs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, these women are spies!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, they want the Kill Switch virus. What did you tell her?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn’t tell them anything!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to know!

speaker: MULDER
line: Look...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do we have it? Do we have the Kill Switch?

speaker: MULDER
line: Of course we do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Scully? Scully, help! Help! Help!! Sculleeee!!!

speaker: ESTHER
line: Here, kitty, kitty, kitty, kitty, kitty, kitty.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?! Mulder, are you all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m in here. Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder. Mulder, can you hear me? Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Help me out here, Esther. What’s its next move? What is it thinking?

speaker: ESTHER
line: I don’t know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who built this?

speaker: ESTHER
line: It did. There. Ah! David! Oh, god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder? Mulder, can you hear me? Mulder, talk to me.

speaker: ESTHER
line: It wants the Kill Switch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we don’t have it. You threw it in the water with the computer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That’s going to kill it, right?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Not if it can learn the program and vaccinate itself against it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give it what it wants, Esther. Put it in, Esther.

speaker: ESTHER
line: It’s targeting us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put it in!

speaker: PLATTERS
line: HEAVENLY SHADES OF NIGHT ARE FALLING IT’S TWILIGHT TIME

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re going to be okay. I’m going to get you out of here.

speaker: PLATTERS
line: OUT OF THE MIST YOUR VOICE IS CALLING IT’S TWILIGHT TIME. WHEN PURPLE COLORED CURTAINS MARK THE END OF DAY I’LL HEAR YOU, MY DEAR AT TWILIGHT TIME

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. It’s okay.

speaker: PLATTERS
line: DEEPING SHADOWS GATHER SPLENDOR AS DAY IS DONE FINGERS OF NIGHT WILL SOON SURRENDER THE SETTING SUN I COUNT THE MOMENTS DARLING TIL YOU’RE HERE WITH ME TOGETHER AT LAST AT TWILIGHT TIME

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing, Esther?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Go!

speaker: PLATTERS
line: HERE IN THE AFTERGLOW OF DAY WE KEEP OUR RENDEZVOUS BENEATH THE BLUE HERE IN THE SAME AND SWEET OLD WAY

speaker: PLATTERS
line: I FALL IN LOVE AGAIN AS I DID THEN

speaker: SCULLY
line: Esther?!

speaker: ESTHER
line: You don’t listen, do you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you?

speaker: ESTHER
line: Get out of here, now!

speaker: PLATTERS
line: DEEP IN THE DARK YOUR KISS WILL THRILL ME LIKE DAYS OF OLD LIGHTING THE SPARK OF LOVE THAT FILLS ME WITH DREAMS UNTOLD.

speaker: ESTHER
line: Upload.

speaker: PLATTERS
line: EACH DAY I PRAY FOR EVENING JUST TO BE WITH YOU TOGETHER, AT LAST AT TWILIGHT TIME TOGETHER, AT LAST AT TWILIGHT TIME

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if Esther wanted to leave her body, she got her wish. At least that part of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wonder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, she’s dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if she managed to establish an uplink, Scully? A satellite transmission?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, are you telling me that Esther may have... that she may not be dead?

speaker: MULDER
line: Artificial life. It could exist. It could be here among us, evolving.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Electrons chasing each other through a circuit --- that isn’t life, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but what are we but impulses? Electrical and chemical through a bag of meat and bones. You’re the scientist. You tell me.

speaker: ONLOOKER
line: You did it now, Harley!

speaker: HARLEY
line: You get it.

speaker: OTHER PLAYER
line: Uh unh.

speaker: FEMALE ONLOOKER
line: They’ll get you if you go in there!

speaker: HARLEY
line: Mama says no one lives in there.
